31#include <sys/cdefs.h>
32__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: i915_gem_execbuffer.c,v 1.8 2018/08/27 07:08:20 riastradh Exp $");
33
34#include <drm/drmP.h>
35#include <drm/i915_drm.h>
36#include "i915_drv.h"
37#include "i915_trace.h"
38#include "intel_drv.h"
39#include <linux/dma_remapping.h>
40#include <linux/uaccess.h>
41#include <linux/log2.h>
42#include <linux/pagemap.h>
43#include <linux/err.h>
44#include <asm/cpufeature.h>
45
46#define __EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_PIN (1<<31)
47#define __EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_FENCE (1<<30)
48#define __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_MAP (1<<29)
49#define __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_BIAS (1<<28)
50
51#define BATCH_OFFSET_BIAS (256*1024)
52
53struct eb_vmas {
54 struct list_head vmas;
55 int and;
56 union {
57 struct i915_vma *lut[0];
58 struct hlist_head buckets[0];
59 };
60};
61
62static struct eb_vmas *
63eb_create(struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer2 *args)
64{
65 struct eb_vmas *eb = NULL;
66
67 if (args->flags & I915_EXEC_HANDLE_LUT) {
68 unsigned size = args->buffer_count;
69 size *= sizeof(struct i915_vma *);
70 size += sizeof(struct eb_vmas);
71 eb = kmalloc(size, GFP_TEMPORARY | __GFP_NOWARN | __GFP_NORETRY);
72 }
73
74 if (eb == NULL) {
75 unsigned size = args->buffer_count;
76 unsigned count = PAGE_SIZE / sizeof(struct hlist_head) / 2;
77 BUILD_BUG_ON_NOT_POWER_OF_2(PAGE_SIZE / sizeof(struct hlist_head));
78 while (count > 2*size)
79 count >>= 1;
80 eb = kzalloc(count*sizeof(struct hlist_head) +
81 sizeof(struct eb_vmas),
82 GFP_TEMPORARY);
83 if (eb == NULL)
84 return eb;
85
86 eb->and = count - 1;
87 } else
88 eb->and = -args->buffer_count;
89
90 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&eb->vmas);
91 return eb;
92}
93
94static void
95eb_reset(struct eb_vmas *eb)
96{
97 if (eb->and >= 0)
98 memset(eb->buckets, 0, (eb->and+1)*sizeof(struct hlist_head));
99}
100
101static int
102eb_lookup_vmas(struct eb_vmas *eb,
103 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *exec,
104 const struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer2 *args,
105 struct i915_address_space *vm,
106 struct drm_file *file)
107{
108 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
109 struct list_head objects;
110 int i, ret;
111
112 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&objects);
113 spin_lock(&file->table_lock);
114 /* Grab a reference to the object and release the lock so we can lookup
115 * or create the VMA without using GFP_ATOMIC */
116 for (i = 0; i < args->buffer_count; i++) {
117 obj = to_intel_bo((struct drm_gem_object *)
118 idr_find(&file->object_idr, exec[i].handle));
119 if (obj == NULL) {
120 spin_unlock(&file->table_lock);
121 DRM_DEBUG("Invalid object handle %d at index %d\n",
122 exec[i].handle, i);
123 ret = -ENOENT;
124 goto err;
125 }
126
127 if (!list_empty(&obj->obj_exec_link)) {
128 spin_unlock(&file->table_lock);
129 DRM_DEBUG("Object %p [handle %d, index %d] appears more than once in object list\n",
130 obj, exec[i].handle, i);
131 ret = -EINVAL;
132 goto err;
133 }
134
135 drm_gem_object_reference(&obj->base);
136 list_add_tail(&obj->obj_exec_link, &objects);
137 }
138 spin_unlock(&file->table_lock);
139
140 i = 0;
141 while (!list_empty(&objects)) {
142 struct i915_vma *vma;
143
144 obj = list_first_entry(&objects,
145 struct drm_i915_gem_object,
146 obj_exec_link);
147
148 /*
149 * NOTE: We can leak any vmas created here when something fails
150 * later on. But that's no issue since vma_unbind can deal with
151 * vmas which are not actually bound. And since only
152 * lookup_or_create exists as an interface to get at the vma
153 * from the (obj, vm) we don't run the risk of creating
154 * duplicated vmas for the same vm.
155 */
156 vma = i915_gem_obj_lookup_or_create_vma(obj, vm);
157 if (IS_ERR(vma)) {
158 DRM_DEBUG("Failed to lookup VMA\n");
159 ret = PTR_ERR(vma);
160 goto err;
161 }
162
163 /* Transfer ownership from the objects list to the vmas list. */
164 list_add_tail(&vma->exec_list, &eb->vmas);
165 list_del_init(&obj->obj_exec_link);
166
167 vma->exec_entry = &exec[i];
168 if (eb->and < 0) {
169 eb->lut[i] = vma;
170 } else {
171 uint32_t handle = args->flags & I915_EXEC_HANDLE_LUT ? i : exec[i].handle;
172 vma->exec_handle = handle;
173 hlist_add_head(&vma->exec_node,
174 &eb->buckets[handle & eb->and]);
175 }
176 ++i;
177 }
178
179 return 0;
180
181
182err:
183 while (!list_empty(&objects)) {
184 obj = list_first_entry(&objects,
185 struct drm_i915_gem_object,
186 obj_exec_link);
187 list_del_init(&obj->obj_exec_link);
188 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
189 }
190 /*
191 * Objects already transfered to the vmas list will be unreferenced by
192 * eb_destroy.
193 */
194
195 return ret;
196}
197
198static struct i915_vma *eb_get_vma(struct eb_vmas *eb, unsigned long handle)
199{
200 if (eb->and < 0) {
201 if (handle >= -eb->and)
202 return NULL;
203 return eb->lut[handle];
204 } else {
205 struct hlist_head *head;
206 struct hlist_node *node;
207
208 head = &eb->buckets[handle & eb->and];
209 hlist_for_each(node, head) {
210 struct i915_vma *vma;
211
212 vma = hlist_entry(node, struct i915_vma, exec_node);
213 if (vma->exec_handle == handle)
214 return vma;
215 }
216 return NULL;
217 }
218}
219
220static void
221i915_gem_execbuffer_unreserve_vma(struct i915_vma *vma)
222{
223 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *entry;
224 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = vma->obj;
225
226 if (!drm_mm_node_allocated(&vma->node))
227 return;
228
229 entry = vma->exec_entry;
230
231 if (entry->flags & __EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_FENCE)
232 i915_gem_object_unpin_fence(obj);
233
234 if (entry->flags & __EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_PIN)
235 vma->pin_count--;
236
237 entry->flags &= ~(__EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_FENCE | __EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_PIN);
238}
239
240static void eb_destroy(struct eb_vmas *eb)
241{
242 while (!list_empty(&eb->vmas)) {
243 struct i915_vma *vma;
244
245 vma = list_first_entry(&eb->vmas,
246 struct i915_vma,
247 exec_list);
248 list_del_init(&vma->exec_list);
249 i915_gem_execbuffer_unreserve_vma(vma);
250 drm_gem_object_unreference(&vma->obj->base);
251 }
252 kfree(eb);
253}
254
255static inline int use_cpu_reloc(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj)
256{
257 return (HAS_LLC(obj->base.dev) ||
258 obj->base.write_domain == I915_GEM_DOMAIN_CPU ||
259 obj->cache_level != I915_CACHE_NONE);
260}
261
262#ifdef __NetBSD__
263# define __gtt_iomem
264# define __iomem __gtt_iomem
265
266static inline void
267iowrite32(uint32_t value, uint32_t __gtt_iomem *ptr)
268{
269
270 __insn_barrier();
271 *ptr = value;
272}
273#endif
274
275static int
276relocate_entry_cpu(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj,
277 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry *reloc,
278 uint64_t target_offset)
279{
280 struct drm_device *dev = obj->base.dev;
281 uint32_t page_offset = offset_in_page(reloc->offset);
282 uint64_t delta = reloc->delta + target_offset;
283 char *vaddr;
284 int ret;
285
286 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_cpu_domain(obj, true);
287 if (ret)
288 return ret;
289
290 vaddr = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(obj,
291 reloc->offset >> PAGE_SHIFT));
292 *(uint32_t *)(vaddr + page_offset) = lower_32_bits(delta);
293
294 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8) {
295 page_offset = offset_in_page(page_offset + sizeof(uint32_t));
296
297 if (page_offset == 0) {
298 kunmap_atomic(vaddr);
299 vaddr = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(obj,
300 (reloc->offset + sizeof(uint32_t)) >> PAGE_SHIFT));
301 }
302
303 *(uint32_t *)(vaddr + page_offset) = upper_32_bits(delta);
304 }
305
306 kunmap_atomic(vaddr);
307
308 return 0;
309}
310
311static int
312relocate_entry_gtt(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj,
313 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry *reloc,
314 uint64_t target_offset)
315{
316 struct drm_device *dev = obj->base.dev;
317 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
318 uint64_t delta = reloc->delta + target_offset;
319 uint64_t offset;
320 void __iomem *reloc_page;
321 int ret;
322
323 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_gtt_domain(obj, true);
324 if (ret)
325 return ret;
326
327 ret = i915_gem_object_put_fence(obj);
328 if (ret)
329 return ret;
330
331 /* Map the page containing the relocation we're going to perform. */
332 offset = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj);
333 offset += reloc->offset;
334 reloc_page = io_mapping_map_atomic_wc(dev_priv->gtt.mappable,
335 offset & PAGE_MASK);
336 iowrite32(lower_32_bits(delta), (uint32_t __iomem *)
337 ((char __iomem *)reloc_page + offset_in_page(offset)));
338
339 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8) {
340 offset += sizeof(uint32_t);
341
342 if (offset_in_page(offset) == 0) {
343#ifdef __NetBSD__
344 io_mapping_unmap_atomic(dev_priv->gtt.mappable,
345 reloc_page);
346#else
347 io_mapping_unmap_atomic(reloc_page);
348#endif
349 reloc_page =
350 io_mapping_map_atomic_wc(dev_priv->gtt.mappable,
351 offset);
352 }
353
354 iowrite32(upper_32_bits(delta),
355 (uint32_t __iomem *)
356 ((char __iomem *)reloc_page + offset_in_page(offset)));
357 }
358
359#ifdef __NetBSD__
360 io_mapping_unmap_atomic(dev_priv->gtt.mappable,
361 reloc_page);
362#else
363 io_mapping_unmap_atomic(reloc_page);
364#endif
365
366 return 0;
367}
368
369
370#ifdef __NetBSD__
371# undef __gtt_iomem
372# undef __iomem
373#endif
374
375static void
376clflush_write32(void *addr, uint32_t value)
377{
378 /* This is not a fast path, so KISS. */
379 drm_clflush_virt_range(addr, sizeof(uint32_t));
380 *(uint32_t *)addr = value;
381 drm_clflush_virt_range(addr, sizeof(uint32_t));
382}
383
384static int
385relocate_entry_clflush(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj,
386 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry *reloc,
387 uint64_t target_offset)
388{
389 struct drm_device *dev = obj->base.dev;
390 uint32_t page_offset = offset_in_page(reloc->offset);
391 uint64_t delta = (int)reloc->delta + target_offset;
392 char *vaddr;
393 int ret;
394
395 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_gtt_domain(obj, true);
396 if (ret)
397 return ret;
398
399 vaddr = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(obj,
400 reloc->offset >> PAGE_SHIFT));
401 clflush_write32(vaddr + page_offset, lower_32_bits(delta));
402
403 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8) {
404 page_offset = offset_in_page(page_offset + sizeof(uint32_t));
405
406 if (page_offset == 0) {
407 kunmap_atomic(vaddr);
408 vaddr = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(obj,
409 (reloc->offset + sizeof(uint32_t)) >> PAGE_SHIFT));
410 }
411
412 clflush_write32(vaddr + page_offset, upper_32_bits(delta));
413 }
414
415 kunmap_atomic(vaddr);
416
417 return 0;
418}
419
420static int
421i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate_entry(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj,
422 struct eb_vmas *eb,
423 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry *reloc)
424{
425 struct drm_device *dev = obj->base.dev;
426 struct drm_gem_object *target_obj;
427 struct drm_i915_gem_object *target_i915_obj;
428 struct i915_vma *target_vma;
429 uint64_t target_offset;
430 int ret;
431
432 /* we've already hold a reference to all valid objects */
433 target_vma = eb_get_vma(eb, reloc->target_handle);
434 if (unlikely(target_vma == NULL))
435 return -ENOENT;
436 target_i915_obj = target_vma->obj;
437 target_obj = &target_vma->obj->base;
438
439 target_offset = target_vma->node.start;
440
441 /* Sandybridge PPGTT errata: We need a global gtt mapping for MI and
442 * pipe_control writes because the gpu doesn't properly redirect them
443 * through the ppgtt for non_secure batchbuffers. */
444 if (unlikely(IS_GEN6(dev) &&
445 reloc->write_domain == I915_GEM_DOMAIN_INSTRUCTION)) {
446 ret = i915_vma_bind(target_vma, target_i915_obj->cache_level,
447 PIN_GLOBAL);
448 if (WARN_ONCE(ret, "Unexpected failure to bind target VMA!"))
449 return ret;
450 }
451
452 /* Validate that the target is in a valid r/w GPU domain */
453 if (unlikely(reloc->write_domain & (reloc->write_domain - 1))) {
454 DRM_DEBUG("reloc with multiple write domains: "
455 "obj %p target %d offset %d "
456 "read %08x write %08x",
457 obj, reloc->target_handle,
458 (int) reloc->offset,
459 reloc->read_domains,
460 reloc->write_domain);
461 return -EINVAL;
462 }
463 if (unlikely((reloc->write_domain | reloc->read_domains)
464 & ~I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS)) {
465 DRM_DEBUG("reloc with read/write non-GPU domains: "
466 "obj %p target %d offset %d "
467 "read %08x write %08x",
468 obj, reloc->target_handle,
469 (int) reloc->offset,
470 reloc->read_domains,
471 reloc->write_domain);
472 return -EINVAL;
473 }
474
475 target_obj->pending_read_domains |= reloc->read_domains;
476 target_obj->pending_write_domain |= reloc->write_domain;
477
478 /* If the relocation already has the right value in it, no
479 * more work needs to be done.
480 */
481 if (target_offset == reloc->presumed_offset)
482 return 0;
483
484 /* Check that the relocation address is valid... */
485 if (unlikely(reloc->offset >
486 obj->base.size - (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8 ? 8 : 4))) {
487 DRM_DEBUG("Relocation beyond object bounds: "
488 "obj %p target %d offset %d size %d.\n",
489 obj, reloc->target_handle,
490 (int) reloc->offset,
491 (int) obj->base.size);
492 return -EINVAL;
493 }
494 if (unlikely(reloc->offset & 3)) {
495 DRM_DEBUG("Relocation not 4-byte aligned: "
496 "obj %p target %d offset %d.\n",
497 obj, reloc->target_handle,
498 (int) reloc->offset);
499 return -EINVAL;
500 }
501
502#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX atomic GEM reloc fast path */
503 /* We can't wait for rendering with pagefaults disabled */
504 if (obj->active && pagefault_disabled())
505 return -EFAULT;
506#endif
507
508 if (use_cpu_reloc(obj))
509 ret = relocate_entry_cpu(obj, reloc, target_offset);
510 else if (obj->map_and_fenceable)
511 ret = relocate_entry_gtt(obj, reloc, target_offset);
512 else if (cpu_has_clflush)
513 ret = relocate_entry_clflush(obj, reloc, target_offset);
514 else {
515 WARN_ONCE(1, "Impossible case in relocation handling\n");
516 ret = -ENODEV;
517 }
518
519 if (ret)
520 return ret;
521
522 /* and update the user's relocation entry */
523 reloc->presumed_offset = target_offset;
524
525 return 0;
526}
527
528#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX atomic GEM reloc fast path */
529static int
530i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate_vma(struct i915_vma *vma,
531 struct eb_vmas *eb)
532{
533#define N_RELOC(x) ((x) / sizeof(struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry))
534 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry stack_reloc[N_RELOC(512)];
535 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry __user *user_relocs;
536 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *entry = vma->exec_entry;
537 int remain, ret;
538
539 user_relocs = to_user_ptr(entry->relocs_ptr);
540
541 remain = entry->relocation_count;
542 while (remain) {
543 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry *r = stack_reloc;
544 int count = remain;
545 if (count > ARRAY_SIZE(stack_reloc))
546 count = ARRAY_SIZE(stack_reloc);
547 remain -= count;
548
549 if (__copy_from_user_inatomic(r, user_relocs, count*sizeof(r[0])))
550 return -EFAULT;
551
552 do {
553 u64 offset = r->presumed_offset;
554
555 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate_entry(vma->obj, eb, r);
556 if (ret)
557 return ret;
558
559 if (r->presumed_offset != offset &&
560 __copy_to_user_inatomic(&user_relocs->presumed_offset,
561 &r->presumed_offset,
562 sizeof(r->presumed_offset))) {
563 return -EFAULT;
564 }
565
566 user_relocs++;
567 r++;
568 } while (--count);
569 }
570
571 return 0;
572#undef N_RELOC
573}
574#endif
575
576static int
577i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate_vma_slow(struct i915_vma *vma,
578 struct eb_vmas *eb,
579 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry *relocs)
580{
581 const struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *entry = vma->exec_entry;
582 int i, ret;
583
584 for (i = 0; i < entry->relocation_count; i++) {
585 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate_entry(vma->obj, eb, &relocs[i]);
586 if (ret)
587 return ret;
588 }
589
590 return 0;
591}
592
593static int
594i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate(struct eb_vmas *eb)
595{
596#ifndef __NetBSD__
597 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
598 struct i915_vma *vma;
599#endif
600 int ret = 0;
601
602#ifdef __NetBSD__ /* XXX atomic GEM reloc fast path */
603 ret = -EFAULT;
604#else
605 /* This is the fast path and we cannot handle a pagefault whilst
606 * holding the struct mutex lest the user pass in the relocations
607 * contained within a mmaped bo. For in such a case we, the page
608 * fault handler would call i915_gem_fault() and we would try to
609 * acquire the struct mutex again. Obviously this is bad and so
610 * lockdep complains vehemently.
611 */
612 pagefault_disable();
613 list_for_each_entry(vma, &eb->vmas, exec_list) {
614 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate_vma(vma, eb);
615 if (ret)
616 break;
617 }
618 pagefault_enable();
619#endif
620
621 return ret;
622}
623
624static bool only_mappable_for_reloc(unsigned int flags)
625{
626 return (flags & (EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_FENCE | __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_MAP)) ==
627 __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_MAP;
628}
629
630static int
631i915_gem_execbuffer_reserve_vma(struct i915_vma *vma,
632 struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
633 bool *need_reloc)
634{
635 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = vma->obj;
636 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *entry = vma->exec_entry;
637 uint64_t flags;
638 int ret;
639
640 flags = PIN_USER;
641 if (entry->flags & EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_GTT)
642 flags |= PIN_GLOBAL;
643
644 if (!drm_mm_node_allocated(&vma->node)) {
645 /* Wa32bitGeneralStateOffset & Wa32bitInstructionBaseOffset,
646 * limit address to the first 4GBs for unflagged objects.
647 */
648 if ((entry->flags & EXEC_OBJECT_SUPPORTS_48B_ADDRESS) == 0)
649 flags |= PIN_ZONE_4G;
650 if (entry->flags & __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_MAP)
651 flags |= PIN_GLOBAL | PIN_MAPPABLE;
652 if (entry->flags & __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_BIAS)
653 flags |= BATCH_OFFSET_BIAS | PIN_OFFSET_BIAS;
654 if ((flags & PIN_MAPPABLE) == 0)
655 flags |= PIN_HIGH;
656 }
657
658 ret = i915_gem_object_pin(obj, vma->vm, entry->alignment, flags);
659 if ((ret == -ENOSPC || ret == -E2BIG) &&
660 only_mappable_for_reloc(entry->flags))
661 ret = i915_gem_object_pin(obj, vma->vm,
662 entry->alignment,
663 flags & ~PIN_MAPPABLE);
664 if (ret)
665 return ret;
666
667 entry->flags |= __EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_PIN;
668
669 if (entry->flags & EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_FENCE) {
670 ret = i915_gem_object_get_fence(obj);
671 if (ret)
672 return ret;
673
674 if (i915_gem_object_pin_fence(obj))
675 entry->flags |= __EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_FENCE;
676 }
677
678 if (entry->offset != vma->node.start) {
679 entry->offset = vma->node.start;
680 *need_reloc = true;
681 }
682
683 if (entry->flags & EXEC_OBJECT_WRITE) {
684 obj->base.pending_read_domains = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_RENDER;
685 obj->base.pending_write_domain = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_RENDER;
686 }
687
688 return 0;
689}
690
691static bool
692need_reloc_mappable(struct i915_vma *vma)
693{
694 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *entry = vma->exec_entry;
695
696 if (entry->relocation_count == 0)
697 return false;
698
699 if (!i915_is_ggtt(vma->vm))
700 return false;
701
702 /* See also use_cpu_reloc() */
703 if (HAS_LLC(vma->obj->base.dev))
704 return false;
705
706 if (vma->obj->base.write_domain == I915_GEM_DOMAIN_CPU)
707 return false;
708
709 return true;
710}
711
712static bool
713eb_vma_misplaced(struct i915_vma *vma)
714{
715 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *entry = vma->exec_entry;
716 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = vma->obj;
717
718 WARN_ON(entry->flags & __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_MAP &&
719 !i915_is_ggtt(vma->vm));
720
721 if (entry->alignment &&
722 vma->node.start & (entry->alignment - 1))
723 return true;
724
725 if (entry->flags & __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_BIAS &&
726 vma->node.start < BATCH_OFFSET_BIAS)
727 return true;
728
729 /* avoid costly ping-pong once a batch bo ended up non-mappable */
730 if (entry->flags & __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_MAP && !obj->map_and_fenceable)
731 return !only_mappable_for_reloc(entry->flags);
732
733 if ((entry->flags & EXEC_OBJECT_SUPPORTS_48B_ADDRESS) == 0 &&
734 (vma->node.start + vma->node.size - 1) >> 32)
735 return true;
736
737 return false;
738}
739
740static int
741i915_gem_execbuffer_reserve(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
742 struct list_head *vmas,
743 struct intel_context *ctx,
744 bool *need_relocs)
745{
746 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
747 struct i915_vma *vma;
748 struct i915_address_space *vm;
749 struct list_head ordered_vmas;
750 bool has_fenced_gpu_access = INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen < 4;
751 int retry;
752
753 i915_gem_retire_requests_ring(ring);
754
755 vm = list_first_entry(vmas, struct i915_vma, exec_list)->vm;
756
757 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ordered_vmas);
758 while (!list_empty(vmas)) {
759 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *entry;
760 bool need_fence, need_mappable;
761
762 vma = list_first_entry(vmas, struct i915_vma, exec_list);
763 obj = vma->obj;
764 entry = vma->exec_entry;
765
766 if (ctx->flags & CONTEXT_NO_ZEROMAP)
767 entry->flags |= __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_BIAS;
768
769 if (!has_fenced_gpu_access)
770 entry->flags &= ~EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_FENCE;
771 need_fence =
772 entry->flags & EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_FENCE &&
773 obj->tiling_mode != I915_TILING_NONE;
774 need_mappable = need_fence || need_reloc_mappable(vma);
775
776 if (need_mappable) {
777 entry->flags |= __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_MAP;
778 list_move(&vma->exec_list, &ordered_vmas);
779 } else
780 list_move_tail(&vma->exec_list, &ordered_vmas);
781
782 obj->base.pending_read_domains = I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS & ~I915_GEM_DOMAIN_COMMAND;
783 obj->base.pending_write_domain = 0;
784 }
785 list_splice(&ordered_vmas, vmas);
786
787 /* Attempt to pin all of the buffers into the GTT.
788 * This is done in 3 phases:
789 *
790 * 1a. Unbind all objects that do not match the GTT constraints for
791 * the execbuffer (fenceable, mappable, alignment etc).
792 * 1b. Increment pin count for already bound objects.
793 * 2. Bind new objects.
794 * 3. Decrement pin count.
795 *
796 * This avoid unnecessary unbinding of later objects in order to make
797 * room for the earlier objects *unless* we need to defragment.
798 */
799 retry = 0;
800 do {
801 int ret = 0;
802
803 /* Unbind any ill-fitting objects or pin. */
804 list_for_each_entry(vma, vmas, exec_list) {
805 if (!drm_mm_node_allocated(&vma->node))
806 continue;
807
808 if (eb_vma_misplaced(vma))
809 ret = i915_vma_unbind(vma);
810 else
811 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_reserve_vma(vma, ring, need_relocs);
812 if (ret)
813 goto err;
814 }
815
816 /* Bind fresh objects */
817 list_for_each_entry(vma, vmas, exec_list) {
818 if (drm_mm_node_allocated(&vma->node))
819 continue;
820
821 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_reserve_vma(vma, ring, need_relocs);
822 if (ret)
823 goto err;
824 }
825
826err:
827 if (ret != -ENOSPC || retry++)
828 return ret;
829
830 /* Decrement pin count for bound objects */
831 list_for_each_entry(vma, vmas, exec_list)
832 i915_gem_execbuffer_unreserve_vma(vma);
833
834 ret = i915_gem_evict_vm(vm, true);
835 if (ret)
836 return ret;
837 } while (1);
838}
839
840static int
841i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate_slow(struct drm_device *dev,
842 struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer2 *args,
843 struct drm_file *file,
844 struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
845 struct eb_vmas *eb,
846 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *exec,
847 struct intel_context *ctx)
848{
849 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry *reloc;
850 struct i915_address_space *vm;
851 struct i915_vma *vma;
852 bool need_relocs;
853 int *reloc_offset;
854 int i, total, ret;
855 unsigned count = args->buffer_count;
856
857 vm = list_first_entry(&eb->vmas, struct i915_vma, exec_list)->vm;
858
859 /* We may process another execbuffer during the unlock... */
860 while (!list_empty(&eb->vmas)) {
861 vma = list_first_entry(&eb->vmas, struct i915_vma, exec_list);
862 list_del_init(&vma->exec_list);
863 i915_gem_execbuffer_unreserve_vma(vma);
864 drm_gem_object_unreference(&vma->obj->base);
865 }
866
867 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
868
869 total = 0;
870 for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
871 total += exec[i].relocation_count;
872
873 reloc_offset = drm_malloc_ab(count, sizeof(*reloc_offset));
874 reloc = drm_malloc_ab(total, sizeof(*reloc));
875 if (reloc == NULL || reloc_offset == NULL) {
876 drm_free_large(reloc);
877 drm_free_large(reloc_offset);
878 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
879 return -ENOMEM;
880 }
881
882 total = 0;
883 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
884 struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry __user *user_relocs;
885 u64 invalid_offset = (u64)-1;
886 int j;
887
888 user_relocs = to_user_ptr(exec[i].relocs_ptr);
889
890 if (copy_from_user(reloc+total, user_relocs,
891 exec[i].relocation_count * sizeof(*reloc))) {
892 ret = -EFAULT;
893 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
894 goto err;
895 }
896
897 /* As we do not update the known relocation offsets after
898 * relocating (due to the complexities in lock handling),
899 * we need to mark them as invalid now so that we force the
900 * relocation processing next time. Just in case the target
901 * object is evicted and then rebound into its old
902 * presumed_offset before the next execbuffer - if that
903 * happened we would make the mistake of assuming that the
904 * relocations were valid.
905 */
906 for (j = 0; j < exec[i].relocation_count; j++) {
907 if (__copy_to_user(&user_relocs[j].presumed_offset,
908 &invalid_offset,
909 sizeof(invalid_offset))) {
910 ret = -EFAULT;
911 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
912 goto err;
913 }
914 }
915
916 reloc_offset[i] = total;
917 total += exec[i].relocation_count;
918 }
919
920 ret = i915_mutex_lock_interruptible(dev);
921 if (ret) {
922 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
923 goto err;
924 }
925
926 /* reacquire the objects */
927 eb_reset(eb);
928 ret = eb_lookup_vmas(eb, exec, args, vm, file);
929 if (ret)
930 goto err;
931
932 need_relocs = (args->flags & I915_EXEC_NO_RELOC) == 0;
933 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_reserve(ring, &eb->vmas, ctx, &need_relocs);
934 if (ret)
935 goto err;
936
937 list_for_each_entry(vma, &eb->vmas, exec_list) {
938 int offset = vma->exec_entry - exec;
939 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate_vma_slow(vma, eb,
940 reloc + reloc_offset[offset]);
941 if (ret)
942 goto err;
943 }
944
945 /* Leave the user relocations as are, this is the painfully slow path,
946 * and we want to avoid the complication of dropping the lock whilst
947 * having buffers reserved in the aperture and so causing spurious
948 * ENOSPC for random operations.
949 */
950
951err:
952 drm_free_large(reloc);
953 drm_free_large(reloc_offset);
954 return ret;
955}
956
957static int
958i915_gem_execbuffer_move_to_gpu(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
959 struct list_head *vmas)
960{
961 const unsigned other_rings = ~intel_ring_flag(req->ring);
962 struct i915_vma *vma;
963 uint32_t flush_domains = 0;
964 bool flush_chipset = false;
965 int ret;
966
967 list_for_each_entry(vma, vmas, exec_list) {
968 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = vma->obj;
969
970 if (obj->active & other_rings) {
971 ret = i915_gem_object_sync(obj, req->ring, &req);
972 if (ret)
973 return ret;
974 }
975
976 if (obj->base.write_domain & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_CPU)
977 flush_chipset |= i915_gem_clflush_object(obj, false);
978
979 flush_domains |= obj->base.write_domain;
980 }
981
982 if (flush_chipset)
983 i915_gem_chipset_flush(req->ring->dev);
984
985 if (flush_domains & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_GTT)
986 wmb();
987
988 /* Unconditionally invalidate gpu caches and ensure that we do flush
989 * any residual writes from the previous batch.
990 */
991 return intel_ring_invalidate_all_caches(req);
992}
993
994static bool
995i915_gem_check_execbuffer(struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer2 *exec)
996{
997 if (exec->flags & __I915_EXEC_UNKNOWN_FLAGS)
998 return false;
999
1000 /* Kernel clipping was a DRI1 misfeature */
1001 if (exec->num_cliprects || exec->cliprects_ptr)
1002 return false;
1003
1004 if (exec->DR4 == 0xffffffff) {
1005 DRM_DEBUG("UXA submitting garbage DR4, fixing up\n");
1006 exec->DR4 = 0;
1007 }
1008 if (exec->DR1 || exec->DR4)
1009 return false;
1010
1011 if ((exec->batch_start_offset | exec->batch_len) & 0x7)
1012 return false;
1013
1014 return true;
1015}
1016
1017static int
1018validate_exec_list(struct drm_device *dev,
1019 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *exec,
1020 int count)
1021{
1022 unsigned relocs_total = 0;
1023 unsigned relocs_max = UINT_MAX / sizeof(struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry);
1024 unsigned invalid_flags;
1025 int i;
1026
1027 invalid_flags = __EXEC_OBJECT_UNKNOWN_FLAGS;
1028 if (USES_FULL_PPGTT(dev))
1029 invalid_flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_GTT;
1030
1031 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
1032 char __user *ptr = to_user_ptr(exec[i].relocs_ptr);
1033 int length; /* limited by fault_in_pages_readable() */
1034
1035 if (exec[i].flags & invalid_flags)
1036 return -EINVAL;
1037
1038 if (exec[i].alignment && !is_power_of_2(exec[i].alignment))
1039 return -EINVAL;
1040
1041 /* First check for malicious input causing overflow in
1042 * the worst case where we need to allocate the entire
1043 * relocation tree as a single array.
1044 */
1045 if (exec[i].relocation_count > relocs_max - relocs_total)
1046 return -EINVAL;
1047 relocs_total += exec[i].relocation_count;
1048
1049 length = exec[i].relocation_count *
1050 sizeof(struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry);
1051 /*
1052 * We must check that the entire relocation array is safe
1053 * to read, but since we may need to update the presumed
1054 * offsets during execution, check for full write access.
1055 */
1056 if (!access_ok(VERIFY_WRITE, ptr, length))
1057 return -EFAULT;
1058
1059 if (likely(!i915.prefault_disable)) {
1060 if (fault_in_multipages_readable(ptr, length))
1061 return -EFAULT;
1062 }
1063 }
1064
1065 return 0;
1066}
1067
1068static struct intel_context *
1069i915_gem_validate_context(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file,
1070 struct intel_engine_cs *ring, const u32 ctx_id)
1071{
1072 struct intel_context *ctx = NULL;
1073 struct i915_ctx_hang_stats *hs;
1074
1075 if (ring->id != RCS && ctx_id != DEFAULT_CONTEXT_HANDLE)
1076 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
1077
1078 ctx = i915_gem_context_get(file->driver_priv, ctx_id);
1079 if (IS_ERR(ctx))
1080 return ctx;
1081
1082 hs = &ctx->hang_stats;
1083 if (hs->banned) {
1084 DRM_DEBUG("Context %u tried to submit while banned\n", ctx_id);
1085 return ERR_PTR(-EIO);
1086 }
1087
1088 if (i915.enable_execlists && !ctx->engine[ring->id].state) {
1089 int ret = intel_lr_context_deferred_alloc(ctx, ring);
1090 if (ret) {
1091 DRM_DEBUG("Could not create LRC %u: %d\n", ctx_id, ret);
1092 return ERR_PTR(ret);
1093 }
1094 }
1095
1096 return ctx;
1097}
1098
1099void
1100i915_gem_execbuffer_move_to_active(struct list_head *vmas,
1101 struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
1102{
1103 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = i915_gem_request_get_ring(req);
1104 struct i915_vma *vma;
1105
1106 list_for_each_entry(vma, vmas, exec_list) {
1107 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *entry = vma->exec_entry;
1108 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = vma->obj;
1109 u32 old_read = obj->base.read_domains;
1110 u32 old_write = obj->base.write_domain;
1111
1112 obj->dirty = 1; /* be paranoid */
1113 obj->base.write_domain = obj->base.pending_write_domain;
1114 if (obj->base.write_domain == 0)
1115 obj->base.pending_read_domains |= obj->base.read_domains;
1116 obj->base.read_domains = obj->base.pending_read_domains;
1117
1118 i915_vma_move_to_active(vma, req);
1119 if (obj->base.write_domain) {
1120 i915_gem_request_assign(&obj->last_write_req, req);
1121
1122 intel_fb_obj_invalidate(obj, ORIGIN_CS);
1123
1124 /* update for the implicit flush after a batch */
1125 obj->base.write_domain &= ~I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS;
1126 }
1127 if (entry->flags & EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_FENCE) {
1128 i915_gem_request_assign(&obj->last_fenced_req, req);
1129 if (entry->flags & __EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_FENCE) {
1130 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(ring->dev);
1131 list_move_tail(&dev_priv->fence_regs[obj->fence_reg].lru_list,
1132 &dev_priv->mm.fence_list);
1133 }
1134 }
1135
1136 trace_i915_gem_object_change_domain(obj, old_read, old_write);
1137 }
1138}
1139
1140void
1141i915_gem_execbuffer_retire_commands(struct i915_execbuffer_params *params)
1142{
1143 /* Unconditionally force add_request to emit a full flush. */
1144 params->ring->gpu_caches_dirty = true;
1145
1146 /* Add a breadcrumb for the completion of the batch buffer */
1147 __i915_add_request(params->request, params->batch_obj, true);
1148}
1149
1150static int
1151i915_reset_gen7_sol_offsets(struct drm_device *dev,
1152 struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
1153{
1154 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
1155 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1156 int ret, i;
1157
1158 if (!IS_GEN7(dev) || ring != &dev_priv->ring[RCS]) {
1159 DRM_DEBUG("sol reset is gen7/rcs only\n");
1160 return -EINVAL;
1161 }
1162
1163 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 4 * 3);
1164 if (ret)
1165 return ret;
1166
1167 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
1168 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(1));
1169 intel_ring_emit(ring, GEN7_SO_WRITE_OFFSET(i));
1170 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
1171 }
1172
1173 intel_ring_advance(ring);
1174
1175 return 0;
1176}
1177
1178static struct drm_i915_gem_object*
1179i915_gem_execbuffer_parse(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
1180 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *shadow_exec_entry,
1181 struct eb_vmas *eb,
1182 struct drm_i915_gem_object *batch_obj,
1183 u32 batch_start_offset,
1184 u32 batch_len,
1185 bool is_master)
1186{
1187 struct drm_i915_gem_object *shadow_batch_obj;
1188 struct i915_vma *vma;
1189 int ret;
1190
1191 shadow_batch_obj = i915_gem_batch_pool_get(&ring->batch_pool,
1192 PAGE_ALIGN(batch_len));
1193 if (IS_ERR(shadow_batch_obj))
1194 return shadow_batch_obj;
1195
1196 ret = i915_parse_cmds(ring,
1197 batch_obj,
1198 shadow_batch_obj,
1199 batch_start_offset,
1200 batch_len,
1201 is_master);
1202 if (ret)
1203 goto err;
1204
1205 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(shadow_batch_obj, 0, 0);
1206 if (ret)
1207 goto err;
1208
1209 i915_gem_object_unpin_pages(shadow_batch_obj);
1210
1211 memset(shadow_exec_entry, 0, sizeof(*shadow_exec_entry));
1212
1213 vma = i915_gem_obj_to_ggtt(shadow_batch_obj);
1214 vma->exec_entry = shadow_exec_entry;
1215 vma->exec_entry->flags = __EXEC_OBJECT_HAS_PIN;
1216 drm_gem_object_reference(&shadow_batch_obj->base);
1217 list_add_tail(&vma->exec_list, &eb->vmas);
1218
1219 shadow_batch_obj->base.pending_read_domains = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_COMMAND;
1220
1221 return shadow_batch_obj;
1222
1223err:
1224 i915_gem_object_unpin_pages(shadow_batch_obj);
1225 if (ret == -EACCES) /* unhandled chained batch */
1226 return batch_obj;
1227 else
1228 return ERR_PTR(ret);
1229}
1230
1231int
1232i915_gem_ringbuffer_submission(struct i915_execbuffer_params *params,
1233 struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer2 *args,
1234 struct list_head *vmas)
1235{
1236 struct drm_device *dev = params->dev;
1237 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = params->ring;
1238 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1239 u64 exec_start, exec_len;
1240 int instp_mode;
1241 u32 instp_mask;
1242 int ret;
1243
1244 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_move_to_gpu(params->request, vmas);
1245 if (ret)
1246 return ret;
1247
1248 ret = i915_switch_context(params->request);
1249 if (ret)
1250 return ret;
1251
1252 WARN(params->ctx->ppgtt && params->ctx->ppgtt->pd_dirty_rings & (1<<ring->id),
1253 "%s didn't clear reload\n", ring->name);
1254
1255 instp_mode = args->flags & I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_MASK;
1256 instp_mask = I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_MASK;
1257 switch (instp_mode) {
1258 case I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_REL_GENERAL:
1259 case I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_ABSOLUTE:
1260 case I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_REL_SURFACE:
1261 if (instp_mode != 0 && ring != &dev_priv->ring[RCS]) {
1262 DRM_DEBUG("non-0 rel constants mode on non-RCS\n");
1263 return -EINVAL;
1264 }
1265
1266 if (instp_mode != dev_priv->relative_constants_mode) {
1267 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 4) {
1268 DRM_DEBUG("no rel constants on pre-gen4\n");
1269 return -EINVAL;
1270 }
1271
1272 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen > 5 &&
1273 instp_mode == I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_REL_SURFACE) {
1274 DRM_DEBUG("rel surface constants mode invalid on gen5+\n");
1275 return -EINVAL;
1276 }
1277
1278 /* The HW changed the meaning on this bit on gen6 */
1279 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 6)
1280 instp_mask &= ~I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_REL_SURFACE;
1281 }
1282 break;
1283 default:
1284 DRM_DEBUG("execbuf with unknown constants: %d\n", instp_mode);
1285 return -EINVAL;
1286 }
1287
1288 if (ring == &dev_priv->ring[RCS] &&
1289 instp_mode != dev_priv->relative_constants_mode) {
1290 ret = intel_ring_begin(params->request, 4);
1291 if (ret)
1292 return ret;
1293
1294 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
1295 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(1));
1296 intel_ring_emit(ring, INSTPM);
1297 intel_ring_emit(ring, instp_mask << 16 | instp_mode);
1298 intel_ring_advance(ring);
1299
1300 dev_priv->relative_constants_mode = instp_mode;
1301 }
1302
1303 if (args->flags & I915_EXEC_GEN7_SOL_RESET) {
1304 ret = i915_reset_gen7_sol_offsets(dev, params->request);
1305 if (ret)
1306 return ret;
1307 }
1308
1309 exec_len = args->batch_len;
1310 exec_start = params->batch_obj_vm_offset +
1311 params->args_batch_start_offset;
1312
1313 ret = ring->dispatch_execbuffer(params->request,
1314 exec_start, exec_len,
1315 params->dispatch_flags);
1316 if (ret)
1317 return ret;
1318
1319 trace_i915_gem_ring_dispatch(params->request, params->dispatch_flags);
1320
1321 i915_gem_execbuffer_move_to_active(vmas, params->request);
1322 i915_gem_execbuffer_retire_commands(params);
1323
1324 return 0;
1325}
1326
1327/**
1328 * Find one BSD ring to dispatch the corresponding BSD command.
1329 * The Ring ID is returned.
1330 */
1331static int gen8_dispatch_bsd_ring(struct drm_device *dev,
1332 struct drm_file *file)
1333{
1334 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1335 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv = file->driver_priv;
1336
1337 /* Check whether the file_priv is using one ring */
1338 if (file_priv->bsd_ring)
1339 return file_priv->bsd_ring->id;
1340 else {
1341 /* If no, use the ping-pong mechanism to select one ring */
1342 int ring_id;
1343
1344 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1345 if (dev_priv->mm.bsd_ring_dispatch_index == 0) {
1346 ring_id = VCS;
1347 dev_priv->mm.bsd_ring_dispatch_index = 1;
1348 } else {
1349 ring_id = VCS2;
1350 dev_priv->mm.bsd_ring_dispatch_index = 0;
1351 }
1352 file_priv->bsd_ring = &dev_priv->ring[ring_id];
1353 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1354 return ring_id;
1355 }
1356}
1357
1358static struct drm_i915_gem_object *
1359eb_get_batch(struct eb_vmas *eb)
1360{
1361 struct i915_vma *vma = list_entry(eb->vmas.prev, typeof(*vma), exec_list);
1362
1363 /*
1364 * SNA is doing fancy tricks with compressing batch buffers, which leads
1365 * to negative relocation deltas. Usually that works out ok since the
1366 * relocate address is still positive, except when the batch is placed
1367 * very low in the GTT. Ensure this doesn't happen.
1368 *
1369 * Note that actual hangs have only been observed on gen7, but for
1370 * paranoia do it everywhere.
1371 */
1372 vma->exec_entry->flags |= __EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_BIAS;
1373
1374 return vma->obj;
1375}
1376
1377static int
1378i915_gem_do_execbuffer(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
1379 struct drm_file *file,
1380 struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer2 *args,
1381 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *exec)
1382{
1383 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1384 struct eb_vmas *eb;
1385 struct drm_i915_gem_object *batch_obj;
1386 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 shadow_exec_entry;
1387 struct intel_engine_cs *ring;
1388 struct intel_context *ctx;
1389 struct i915_address_space *vm;
1390 struct i915_execbuffer_params params_master; /* XXX: will be removed later */
1391 struct i915_execbuffer_params *params = &params_master;
1392 const u32 ctx_id = i915_execbuffer2_get_context_id(*args);
1393 u32 dispatch_flags;
1394 int ret;
1395 bool need_relocs;
1396
1397 if (!i915_gem_check_execbuffer(args))
1398 return -EINVAL;
1399
1400 ret = validate_exec_list(dev, exec, args->buffer_count);
1401 if (ret)
1402 return ret;
1403
1404 dispatch_flags = 0;
1405 if (args->flags & I915_EXEC_SECURE) {
1406#ifdef __NetBSD__
1407 if (!file->is_master || !DRM_SUSER())
1408 return -EPERM;
1409#else
1410 if (!file->is_master || !capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
1411 return -EPERM;
1412#endif
1413
1414 dispatch_flags |= I915_DISPATCH_SECURE;
1415 }
1416 if (args->flags & I915_EXEC_IS_PINNED)
1417 dispatch_flags |= I915_DISPATCH_PINNED;
1418
1419 if ((args->flags & I915_EXEC_RING_MASK) > LAST_USER_RING) {
1420 DRM_DEBUG("execbuf with unknown ring: %d\n",
1421 (int)(args->flags & I915_EXEC_RING_MASK));
1422 return -EINVAL;
1423 }
1424
1425 if (((args->flags & I915_EXEC_RING_MASK) != I915_EXEC_BSD) &&
1426 ((args->flags & I915_EXEC_BSD_MASK) != 0)) {
1427 DRM_DEBUG("execbuf with non bsd ring but with invalid "
1428 "bsd dispatch flags: %d\n", (int)(args->flags));
1429 return -EINVAL;
1430 }
1431
1432 if ((args->flags & I915_EXEC_RING_MASK) == I915_EXEC_DEFAULT)
1433 ring = &dev_priv->ring[RCS];
1434 else if ((args->flags & I915_EXEC_RING_MASK) == I915_EXEC_BSD) {
1435 if (HAS_BSD2(dev)) {
1436 int ring_id;
1437
1438 switch (args->flags & I915_EXEC_BSD_MASK) {
1439 case I915_EXEC_BSD_DEFAULT:
1440 ring_id = gen8_dispatch_bsd_ring(dev, file);
1441 ring = &dev_priv->ring[ring_id];
1442 break;
1443 case I915_EXEC_BSD_RING1:
1444 ring = &dev_priv->ring[VCS];
1445 break;
1446 case I915_EXEC_BSD_RING2:
1447 ring = &dev_priv->ring[VCS2];
1448 break;
1449 default:
1450 DRM_DEBUG("execbuf with unknown bsd ring: %d\n",
1451 (int)(args->flags & I915_EXEC_BSD_MASK));
1452 return -EINVAL;
1453 }
1454 } else
1455 ring = &dev_priv->ring[VCS];
1456 } else
1457 ring = &dev_priv->ring[(args->flags & I915_EXEC_RING_MASK) - 1];
1458
1459 if (!intel_ring_initialized(ring)) {
1460 DRM_DEBUG("execbuf with invalid ring: %d\n",
1461 (int)(args->flags & I915_EXEC_RING_MASK));
1462 return -EINVAL;
1463 }
1464
1465 if (args->buffer_count < 1) {
1466 DRM_DEBUG("execbuf with %d buffers\n", args->buffer_count);
1467 return -EINVAL;
1468 }
1469
1470 if (args->flags & I915_EXEC_RESOURCE_STREAMER) {
1471 if (!HAS_RESOURCE_STREAMER(dev)) {
1472 DRM_DEBUG("RS is only allowed for Haswell, Gen8 and above\n");
1473 return -EINVAL;
1474 }
1475 if (ring->id != RCS) {
1476 DRM_DEBUG("RS is not available on %s\n",
1477 ring->name);
1478 return -EINVAL;
1479 }
1480
1481 dispatch_flags |= I915_DISPATCH_RS;
1482 }
1483
1484 intel_runtime_pm_get(dev_priv);
1485
1486 ret = i915_mutex_lock_interruptible(dev);
1487 if (ret)
1488 goto pre_mutex_err;
1489
1490 ctx = i915_gem_validate_context(dev, file, ring, ctx_id);
1491 if (IS_ERR(ctx)) {
1492 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1493 ret = PTR_ERR(ctx);
1494 goto pre_mutex_err;
1495 }
1496
1497 i915_gem_context_reference(ctx);
1498
1499 if (ctx->ppgtt)
1500 vm = &ctx->ppgtt->base;
1501 else
1502 vm = &dev_priv->gtt.base;
1503
1504 memset(&params_master, 0x00, sizeof(params_master));
1505
1506 eb = eb_create(args);
1507 if (eb == NULL) {
1508 i915_gem_context_unreference(ctx);
1509 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1510 ret = -ENOMEM;
1511 goto pre_mutex_err;
1512 }
1513
1514 /* Look up object handles */
1515 ret = eb_lookup_vmas(eb, exec, args, vm, file);
1516 if (ret)
1517 goto err;
1518
1519 /* take note of the batch buffer before we might reorder the lists */
1520 batch_obj = eb_get_batch(eb);
1521
1522 /* Move the objects en-masse into the GTT, evicting if necessary. */
1523 need_relocs = (args->flags & I915_EXEC_NO_RELOC) == 0;
1524 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_reserve(ring, &eb->vmas, ctx, &need_relocs);
1525 if (ret)
1526 goto err;
1527
1528 /* The objects are in their final locations, apply the relocations. */
1529 if (need_relocs)
1530 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate(eb);
1531 if (ret) {
1532 if (ret == -EFAULT) {
1533 ret = i915_gem_execbuffer_relocate_slow(dev, args, file, ring,
1534 eb, exec, ctx);
1535 BUG_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&dev->struct_mutex));
1536 }
1537 if (ret)
1538 goto err;
1539 }
1540
1541 /* Set the pending read domains for the batch buffer to COMMAND */
1542 if (batch_obj->base.pending_write_domain) {
1543 DRM_DEBUG("Attempting to use self-modifying batch buffer\n");
1544 ret = -EINVAL;
1545 goto err;
1546 }
1547
1548 params->args_batch_start_offset = args->batch_start_offset;
1549 if (i915_needs_cmd_parser(ring) && args->batch_len) {
1550 struct drm_i915_gem_object *parsed_batch_obj;
1551
1552 parsed_batch_obj = i915_gem_execbuffer_parse(ring,
1553 &shadow_exec_entry,
1554 eb,
1555 batch_obj,
1556 args->batch_start_offset,
1557 args->batch_len,
1558 file->is_master);
1559 if (IS_ERR(parsed_batch_obj)) {
1560 ret = PTR_ERR(parsed_batch_obj);
1561 goto err;
1562 }
1563
1564 /*
1565 * parsed_batch_obj == batch_obj means batch not fully parsed:
1566 * Accept, but don't promote to secure.
1567 */
1568
1569 if (parsed_batch_obj != batch_obj) {
1570 /*
1571 * Batch parsed and accepted:
1572 *
1573 * Set the DISPATCH_SECURE bit to remove the NON_SECURE
1574 * bit from MI_BATCH_BUFFER_START commands issued in
1575 * the dispatch_execbuffer implementations. We
1576 * specifically don't want that set on batches the
1577 * command parser has accepted.
1578 */
1579 dispatch_flags |= I915_DISPATCH_SECURE;
1580 params->args_batch_start_offset = 0;
1581 batch_obj = parsed_batch_obj;
1582 }
1583 }
1584
1585 batch_obj->base.pending_read_domains |= I915_GEM_DOMAIN_COMMAND;
1586
1587 /* snb/ivb/vlv conflate the "batch in ppgtt" bit with the "non-secure
1588 * batch" bit. Hence we need to pin secure batches into the global gtt.
1589 * hsw should have this fixed, but bdw mucks it up again. */
1590 if (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_SECURE) {
1591 /*
1592 * So on first glance it looks freaky that we pin the batch here
1593 * outside of the reservation loop. But:
1594 * - The batch is already pinned into the relevant ppgtt, so we
1595 * already have the backing storage fully allocated.
1596 * - No other BO uses the global gtt (well contexts, but meh),
1597 * so we don't really have issues with multiple objects not
1598 * fitting due to fragmentation.
1599 * So this is actually safe.
1600 */
1601 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(batch_obj, 0, 0);
1602 if (ret)
1603 goto err;
1604
1605 params->batch_obj_vm_offset = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(batch_obj);
1606 } else
1607 params->batch_obj_vm_offset = i915_gem_obj_offset(batch_obj, vm);
1608
1609 /* Allocate a request for this batch buffer nice and early. */
1610 ret = i915_gem_request_alloc(ring, ctx, &params->request);
1611 if (ret)
1612 goto err_batch_unpin;
1613
1614 ret = i915_gem_request_add_to_client(params->request, file);
1615 if (ret)
1616 goto err_batch_unpin;
1617
1618 /*
1619 * Save assorted stuff away to pass through to *_submission().
1620 * NB: This data should be 'persistent' and not local as it will
1621 * kept around beyond the duration of the IOCTL once the GPU
1622 * scheduler arrives.
1623 */
1624 params->dev = dev;
1625 params->file = file;
1626 params->ring = ring;
1627 params->dispatch_flags = dispatch_flags;
1628 params->batch_obj = batch_obj;
1629 params->ctx = ctx;
1630
1631 ret = dev_priv->gt.execbuf_submit(params, args, &eb->vmas);
1632
1633err_batch_unpin:
1634 /*
1635 * FIXME: We crucially rely upon the active tracking for the (ppgtt)
1636 * batch vma for correctness. For less ugly and less fragility this
1637 * needs to be adjusted to also track the ggtt batch vma properly as
1638 * active.
1639 */
1640 if (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_SECURE)
1641 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(batch_obj);
1642
1643err:
1644 /* the request owns the ref now */
1645 i915_gem_context_unreference(ctx);
1646 eb_destroy(eb);
1647
1648 /*
1649 * If the request was created but not successfully submitted then it
1650 * must be freed again. If it was submitted then it is being tracked
1651 * on the active request list and no clean up is required here.
1652 */
1653 if (ret && params->request)
1654 i915_gem_request_cancel(params->request);
1655
1656 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
1657
1658pre_mutex_err:
1659 /* intel_gpu_busy should also get a ref, so it will free when the device
1660 * is really idle. */
1661 intel_runtime_pm_put(dev_priv);
1662 return ret;
1663}
1664
1665/*
1666 * Legacy execbuffer just creates an exec2 list from the original exec object
1667 * list array and passes it to the real function.
1668 */
1669int
1670i915_gem_execbuffer(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
1671 struct drm_file *file)
1672{
1673 struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer *args = data;
1674 struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer2 exec2;
1675 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object *exec_list = NULL;
1676 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *exec2_list = NULL;
1677 int ret, i;
1678
1679 if (args->buffer_count < 1) {
1680 DRM_DEBUG("execbuf with %d buffers\n", args->buffer_count);
1681 return -EINVAL;
1682 }
1683
1684 /* Copy in the exec list from userland */
1685 exec_list = drm_malloc_ab(sizeof(*exec_list), args->buffer_count);
1686 exec2_list = drm_malloc_ab(sizeof(*exec2_list), args->buffer_count);
1687 if (exec_list == NULL || exec2_list == NULL) {
1688 DRM_DEBUG("Failed to allocate exec list for %d buffers\n",
1689 args->buffer_count);
1690 drm_free_large(exec_list);
1691 drm_free_large(exec2_list);
1692 return -ENOMEM;
1693 }
1694 ret = copy_from_user(exec_list,
1695 to_user_ptr(args->buffers_ptr),
1696 sizeof(*exec_list) * args->buffer_count);
1697 if (ret != 0) {
1698 DRM_DEBUG("copy %d exec entries failed %d\n",
1699 args->buffer_count, ret);
1700 drm_free_large(exec_list);
1701 drm_free_large(exec2_list);
1702 return -EFAULT;
1703 }
1704
1705 for (i = 0; i < args->buffer_count; i++) {
1706 exec2_list[i].handle = exec_list[i].handle;
1707 exec2_list[i].relocation_count = exec_list[i].relocation_count;
1708 exec2_list[i].relocs_ptr = exec_list[i].relocs_ptr;
1709 exec2_list[i].alignment = exec_list[i].alignment;
1710 exec2_list[i].offset = exec_list[i].offset;
1711 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 4)
1712 exec2_list[i].flags = EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_FENCE;
1713 else
1714 exec2_list[i].flags = 0;
1715 }
1716
1717 exec2.buffers_ptr = args->buffers_ptr;
1718 exec2.buffer_count = args->buffer_count;
1719 exec2.batch_start_offset = args->batch_start_offset;
1720 exec2.batch_len = args->batch_len;
1721 exec2.DR1 = args->DR1;
1722 exec2.DR4 = args->DR4;
1723 exec2.num_cliprects = args->num_cliprects;
1724 exec2.cliprects_ptr = args->cliprects_ptr;
1725 exec2.flags = I915_EXEC_RENDER;
1726 i915_execbuffer2_set_context_id(exec2, 0);
1727
1728 ret = i915_gem_do_execbuffer(dev, data, file, &exec2, exec2_list);
1729 if (!ret) {
1730 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object __user *user_exec_list =
1731 to_user_ptr(args->buffers_ptr);
1732
1733 /* Copy the new buffer offsets back to the user's exec list. */
1734 for (i = 0; i < args->buffer_count; i++) {
1735 ret = __copy_to_user(&user_exec_list[i].offset,
1736 &exec2_list[i].offset,
1737 sizeof(user_exec_list[i].offset));
1738 if (ret) {
1739 ret = -EFAULT;
1740 DRM_DEBUG("failed to copy %d exec entries "
1741 "back to user (%d)\n",
1742 args->buffer_count, ret);
1743 break;
1744 }
1745 }
1746 }
1747
1748 drm_free_large(exec_list);
1749 drm_free_large(exec2_list);
1750 return ret;
1751}
1752
1753int
1754i915_gem_execbuffer2(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
1755 struct drm_file *file)
1756{
1757 struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer2 *args = data;
1758 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *exec2_list = NULL;
1759 int ret;
1760
1761 if (args->buffer_count < 1 ||
1762 args->buffer_count > UINT_MAX / sizeof(*exec2_list)) {
1763 DRM_DEBUG("execbuf2 with %d buffers\n", args->buffer_count);
1764 return -EINVAL;
1765 }
1766
1767 if (args->rsvd2 != 0) {
1768 DRM_DEBUG("dirty rvsd2 field\n");
1769 return -EINVAL;
1770 }
1771
1772 exec2_list = kmalloc(sizeof(*exec2_list)*args->buffer_count,
1773 GFP_TEMPORARY | __GFP_NOWARN | __GFP_NORETRY);
1774 if (exec2_list == NULL)
1775 exec2_list = drm_malloc_ab(sizeof(*exec2_list),
1776 args->buffer_count);
1777 if (exec2_list == NULL) {
1778 DRM_DEBUG("Failed to allocate exec list for %d buffers\n",
1779 args->buffer_count);
1780 return -ENOMEM;
1781 }
1782 ret = copy_from_user(exec2_list,
1783 to_user_ptr(args->buffers_ptr),
1784 sizeof(*exec2_list) * args->buffer_count);
1785 if (ret != 0) {
1786 DRM_DEBUG("copy %d exec entries failed %d\n",
1787 args->buffer_count, ret);
1788 drm_free_large(exec2_list);
1789 return -EFAULT;
1790 }
1791
1792 ret = i915_gem_do_execbuffer(dev, data, file, args, exec2_list);
1793 if (!ret) {
1794 /* Copy the new buffer offsets back to the user's exec list. */
1795 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 __user *user_exec_list =
1796 to_user_ptr(args->buffers_ptr);
1797 int i;
1798
1799 for (i = 0; i < args->buffer_count; i++) {
1800 ret = __copy_to_user(&user_exec_list[i].offset,
1801 &exec2_list[i].offset,
1802 sizeof(user_exec_list[i].offset));
1803 if (ret) {
1804 ret = -EFAULT;
1805 DRM_DEBUG("failed to copy %d exec entries "
1806 "back to user\n",
1807 args->buffer_count);
1808 break;
1809 }
1810 }
1811 }
1812
1813 drm_free_large(exec2_list);
1814 return ret;
1815}
